DataElement.preferredName: Participant Consent Future Research Activity Blood And Tissue Storage Other Health Problem Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no response to indicate whether the participant give permissions for their blood and tissue samples to be kept for use in future research about other health problems

Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant give the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant give their permission for their sputum, blood, urine, and tissue samples to be used for research about other health problems (for example: causes of heart disease, osteoporosis, and diabetes?
